message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and figure A suggest gout, which is associated with high levels of uric acid. Among the options, only colchicine decreases microtubule polymerization, which helps reduce the inflammatory response in gout. Option (A) is the mechanism of action of allopurinol, which inhibits uric acid production, and option (B) is the mechanism of action of probenecid, which increases uric acid excretion by inhibiting its reabsorption in the proximal convoluted tubule. Option (C) is the mechanism of action of glucocorticoids, which have anti-inflammatory effects but are not the treatment of choice for acute gout attacks.
